• Consuming unpasteurized foods can increase your risk of foodbourne illness.

• Sous vide cooking often involves temperatures below FDA recommended safe minimum cooking temperatures, but can still be safe when done for the correct amount of time as long as the temperature remains above 54°C (130°F).

• Several factors impact the time required to pasteurize foods, including cooking temperature, initial food temperature, food thickness, and food preparation.

• Follow all proper instructions related to preparation, cooking including time and temperature requirements and storage during sous vide cooking to prevent foodbourne illness caused by harmful bacteria.

• Discard food if it has been at temperatures in the FDA Danger Zone (4°C (40°F) to 60°C (140°F) for more than four hours. Cool foods quickly using an ice bath if not consuming directly after cooking.

Opal is smart enough to know when to start and stop making ice. It’s equipped with a sensor that will identify the fill level of the bucket to turn the ice maker on and off. Just like in any cooler, ice will slowly melt within the air-insulated bucket. Opal will automatically turn on to make sure that the bucket is refilling with ice.

Picking the times you want Opal to make nugget ice is easy. Just tap on the hours of the day you would prefer, and the time will change it\'s color to orange.
You can even tap and drag through times you prefer or drag diagonally through the entire grid of times to choose all.
If you think your schedule could work every day, all you have to do is tap on the button that says \"Apply All Days\" This will change all 7 days of the week to the schedule that you currently see.
Then you will see that the week changed. The orange dots mean that these are the days you have the same schedule.
If you need to change the day of the week you are editing, you can tap on which day you would like to change.
Now you\'re ready to use your Opal Nugget Ice Maker!
